briefdescription.para: Called on the face to notify it there was a finger down event on the face.

detaileddescription.para: At this stage we don't know if this is a click, or the intent is to drag the face to a new one

memberdef.argsstring: (int16_t drag_x, int16_t drag_y, int16_t pos_x, int16_t pos_y, int16_t t_pos_x, int16_t t_pos_y, bool current_face)
memberdef.name: drag

briefdescription.para: Notifies teh face that the user is dragging their finder on the screen an passes in a bunch of info for the method to calculate exactly what the users intent is, which is quite complicated.

detaileddescription.para: Clicks are now handled outside of the face (in display.cpp) so what we try to determine here is if the user intends to swipe teh face to a new one, and what options there are to do that fom this faces navigation options.
When a face is being dragged or swiped to a new face, as it's moving, the face is also responsible to moving the adjacent face.
My plan is to clean this all up/optimise/refine this - eventually

memberdef.argsstring: (int16_t drag_x, int16_t drag_y, bool current_face, int16_t distance, int16_t t_pos_x, int16_t t_pos_y, int16_t last_dir_x, int16_t last_dir_y)
memberdef.name: drag_end

briefdescription.para: Prevent dragging the face - Used for apps that cant be dragged.
Searches through all of the controls added to the face to see if any are "draggable" and if so returns the control.
